channel.title: Comments on: Two and a Half Year Round-up
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Jon Baker
item.dc:creator: Jon Baker
item.description: Geographic info courtesy of Google: Council Bluffs IA is part of the Omaha metro area. Omaha seems to have one of each type of synagogue: O/Ch/C/R/Rc U of Omaha seems to have a substantial Jewish Studies program, with 10 affiliated faculty from other departments. Creighton U seems to have a substantial interfaith presence as well.
item.content:encoded: Geographic info courtesy of Google: Council Bluffs IA is part of the Omaha metro area. Omaha seems to have one of each type of synagogue: O/Ch/C/R/Rc U of Omaha seems to have a substantial Jewish Studies program, with 10 affiliated faculty from other departments. Creighton U seems to have a substantial interfaith presence as well.

item.title: By: Yehudah Mirsky
item.dc:creator: Yehudah Mirsky
item.description: I would be even more interested to hear what sense Council Bluffs IA makes of you.
item.content:encoded: I would be even more interested to hear what sense Council Bluffs IA makes of you.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2012/01/11/two-and-a-half-year-round-up/#comment-4020">Hillel</a>.
Thank You, yes you show up as TA. So my readers who use Bezeq show up as TA. Now if I can only make sense of Council Bluffs, IA.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Hillel.

Thank You, yes you show up as TA. So my readers who use Bezeq show up as TA. Now if I can only make sense of Council Bluffs, IA.

item.title: By: Hillel
item.dc:creator: Hillel
item.description: I'm in Jerusalem, but I think my IP address reads as if it is in Tel Aviv or Ramat Gan (for example, weather websites that read such information assume that I want to know the weather in Tel Aviv or Ramat Gan). This might be because these cities are where the internet providers of Israel lodge. After all, when you consider distance relative to America, Jerusalem and Tel Aviv/Ramat Gan are not too much farther than suburbs of one another. I would guess that many of those listed in your statistics as Tel Aviv are actually residents of Jerusalem and its daughters.
item.content:encoded: I’m in Jerusalem, but I think my IP address reads as if it is in Tel Aviv or Ramat Gan (for example, weather websites that read such information assume that I want to know the weather in Tel Aviv or Ramat Gan). This might be because these cities are where the internet providers of Israel lodge. After all, when you consider distance relative to America, Jerusalem and Tel Aviv/Ramat Gan are not too much farther than suburbs of one another. I would guess that many of those listed in your statistics as Tel Aviv are actually residents of Jerusalem and its daughters.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2012/01/11/two-and-a-half-year-round-up/#comment-4017">YUngerman</a>.
I took NY, Brooklyn, Riverdale, Teaneck, and White Plains, for granted.
Thanks for the app list. How about apps for libraries, scholarship, or seforim? Maybe a HebrewBooks app?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to YUngerman.

I took NY, Brooklyn, Riverdale, Teaneck, and White Plains, for granted.

Thanks for the app list. How about apps for libraries, scholarship, or seforim? Maybe a HebrewBooks app?

item.title: By: YUngerman
item.dc:creator: YUngerman
item.description:
It's kinda weird you didn't mention New York at all.
Here's a great list of "essential" Android apps: http://gizmodo.com/5739420/the-best-android-apps
item.content:encoded:
